bestBHT.bht: In the midst of persecution, believers have the chance to bear witness to their faithfulness and provide testimony for the Lord. This demonstration of loyalty becomes an opportunity to confirm and strengthen believers in the truths of the Gospel, serving as proof of the certainty of Christ's words. The blood of the martyrs serves as the seed for the growth of the church, and by enduring trials and remaining steadfast, believers leave behind a lasting testimony that holds others accountable.

Henry Alford: 13.] for a testimony, viz. of your faithfulness, and (Mark) against them.
Marvin Vincent: It shall turn [αποβησεται] . Lit., turn out; issue.
Philip Schaff: Luke 21:13. It shall turn to you, for a testimony, i.e., of your faithfulness, giving you an opportunity to testify for the Lord, and ‘against them’ (Mark 13:9).
Archibald T. Robertson: It shall turn unto you. It will come off, turn out for you.
For a testimony. To their loyalty to Christ.
The blood of the martyrs is the seed of the church.
John Gill: By this means they would have an opportunity of leaving their testimony for Christ before kings and rulers.
What they should meet with from them, would be a means of strengthening and confirming them in the truths of the Gospel.
Be a proof and evidence to them of the certainty of the above things Christ had said should be accomplished.
John Wesley: It shall turn to you for a testimony — Of your having delivered your own souls, and of their being without excuse.

bhtAttempts.bht: In the face of challenges and persecution, believers may find themselves in situations where their faith is put on display. This can be seen as an opportunity to testify to their loyalty to Christ and bear witness to the truth of the Gospel. The blood of the martyrs is often seen as the seed of the church, and by faithfully enduring in the midst of adversity, believers have the chance to leave a lasting testimony for Christ. This testimony serves as a proof and evidence of the certainty of the words of Christ, strengthening and confirming the believers in the truths of the Gospel.

Amidst trials and opposition, believers have the opportunity to showcase their faithfulness and testify for the Lord. This testimony serves as proof and evidence of the certainty of Christ's words, while also strengthening and confirming believers in the truths of the Gospel. In the face of adversity, the blood of the martyrs becomes the seed of the church. By enduring hardships and remaining steadfast, believers leave a lasting testimony that bears witness to their commitment to Christ and provides an example for others to follow.
